# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df := hype(%(:df) => begin
        transform!(c => :ym, c => :dt) do x
            year(x) * 10000 + trunc(month(x) :: Int64)
        end
        end
    end)
    df
end
```

This function uses the DataFrames.jl package with its transform! function to create a new column named `ym`. The lambda expression inside the transform! function extracts the year and month from each element in the `dt` column, then concatenates them together as an integer in the desired format before storing it in the new `ym` column.
